text.b: School Of Medicine, University of Pennsylvania

page.text: Acquired microscopy images, programed ImageJ macro to quantitatively analyze image data, and used Excel to
further store, manage, analyze data and create table for publications
Mentored, trained, and organized social activities for, summer interns
Financial Institutions Intern, Wholesale Banking Jun. 2010 – Aug. 2010
Supported client coverage team in handing a portfolio of 15 global and local institutional clients, worked
closely with product groups to cross sell Global Market and Transaction Banking products
Communicated with product partners, legal, credit, operational units and service center to ensure smooth
deal implementation and adherence to high levels of service quality
Analyzed financial accounts of, and rating agency reports on, institutional clients

text.b: Professor H. P. James, Brandeis University Boston, MA / Shanghai, China

page.text: Researched rise and fall of foreign and national financial institutions in Shanghai between 1850s and 1949,
with a focus on interplay between macroeconomic forces and historical events that underplayed economic
boom in Shanghai between 1926 and 1934
Researched archival records related to Shanghai’s major property developer, E.D. Sassoon. Co. and its
involvement in The Committee for Assistance of European Refugees in Shanghai
Analyzed business model and acquisition strategies of E.D. Sassoon Co. using various first-hand sources

text.b: Global China Connection, Brandeis Chapter Waltham, MA

page.text: Founder and President May 2010 – May 2011
Initiated chapter formation and approached Global China Connection (GCC) Central with comprehensive chapter
proposals; organized business-themed campus events; maintained on-going communication with Central
Management
